metadata.title: CVE-2024-27055 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:workqueue: Don't call cpumask_test_cpu() with -1 CPU inwq_update_node_max_active()For wq_update_node_max_active(), @off_cpu of -1 indicates that no CPU isgoing down. The function was incorrectly calling cpumask_test_cpu() with -1CPU leading to oopses like the following on some archs:  Unable to handle kernel paging request at virtual addressffff0002100296e0  ..  pc : wq_update_node_max_active+0x50/0x1fc  lr : wq_update_node_max_active+0x1f0/0x1fc  ...  Call trace:    wq_update_node_max_active+0x50/0x1fc    apply_wqattrs_commit+0xf0/0x114    apply_workqueue_attrs_locked+0x58/0xa0    alloc_workqueue+0x5ac/0x774    workqueue_init_early+0x460/0x540    start_kernel+0x258/0x684    __primary_switched+0xb8/0xc0  Code: 9100a273 35000d01 53067f00 d0016dc1 (f8607a60)  ---[ end trace 0000000000000000 ]---  Kernel panic - not syncing: Attempted to kill the idle task!  ---[ end Kernel panic - not syncing: Attempted to kill the idle task!]---Fix it.
